qas.question: On what day was a final treaty signed between the Marshall Islands chiefs and the Germans?
What status did the Marshall Islands have in Germany?
What nation had control of the Carolines?
What notable resource was available in the Marshall Islands?
In what year did Germany buy the Marshalls from Spain?

context: Subsequently, seven other chiefs on seven other islands signed a treaty in German and Marshallese and a final copy witnessed by Rötger on <a0_0>November 1<a0_0/> was sent to the German Foreign Office. The Germans erected a sign declaring a "<a1_0>Imperial German Protectorate<a1_0/>" at Jaluit. It has been speculated that the crisis over the Carolines with <a2_0>Spain<a2_0/>, which almost provoked a war, was in fact "a feint to cover the acquisition of the Marshall Islands", which went almost unnoticed at the time, despite the islands being the largest source of <a3_0>copra<a3_0/> in Micronesia. Spain sold the islands to Germany in <a4_0>1884<a4_0/> through papal mediation.
